channel.title: Brett-Whitehead family history
channel.description: Recent content on Brett-Whitehead family history

item.title: James Whitehead
item.description:
This page is for Sir James Whitehead, 1st Baronet.

James Whitehead was born in Bramhaw, Yorkshire on 2 March 1834.

See James Whitehead’s biography in Liberal History. (thanks to John Oliver for pointing me to this article).

Also see this Peerage.com page on Sir James Whitehead. See the Whitehead grave for some dates.

For more and earlier Whitehead family history see the Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage

He married Mercy Matilda Hinds in 1860.

James died on 20 October 1917.

item.title: Whitehead - Hinds
item.description:
Note for the family of James Whitehead and Mercy Matilda Hinds.

Mercy was born on 20 May 1840 and died 8th May 1911 — see the Whitehead grave.

They married on 30 May 1860. See also BMD record.

Their children were:

  • George Hugh (30 October 1861 - 31 May 1931).
  • Rowland Edward (1 September 1863 - 9 October 1942).
  • Gilbert Hinds.
  • Wilfred James (6 January 1873 - 22 December 1934).
  • Leila Isabel Mercy (21 June 1874 - 11 March 1956).
  • Florence Marion (4 April 1877 - 2 December 1958).

See the Whitehead grave for some dates.

item.title: Richard Allen Pendarves Johns
item.description:
Richard Allen Pendarves Johns was born in Plymouth around September 1892

He was a lieutenant in the 20th Hussars in the 1914-18 war. His National Archives service record has him:

  • With next of kin R. B. Johns, of Plymouth, Father.
  • Reported missing in France on 23 May 1917.
  • Unofficially reported wounded and prisoner of war in 4 June 1917.
  • Noted as “Dead” but this crossed out in one of two places.
  • Repatriated prisoner of war on 5 January 1919.

In fact, he died in India, on 26 October 1922, aged 30. From the search for “Richard Allen Johns” in the “Western Morning News” at https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk, newspaper dated Wednesday 1 November 1922:

item.title: Edmund Allen Johns
item.description:
Edmund Allen was born on 31 May 1865 to Edmund Allen Johns and Clara Louisa Braginton.

See also BMD birth records.

He was born six months after the death of his father, also Edmund Allen, who died on 2 December 1864 (see above).

In the 1891 census, he is living with his half-sister Emmeline, at 8 Roman Road, Chiswick:

Name Age Relation Marriage Profession
Edmund A Johns 26 Head Single Living on own means
Helena E Langford 18 Half-sister Single Scholar
Fanny Gent 62 Servant Single Cook Domestic

The National Archives of the UK (TNA); Kew, Surrey, England; Census Returns of England and Wales, 1891; Class: RG12; Piece: 1034; Folio: 83; Page: 31; GSU roll: 6096144. See the HEL 1891 census original image

item.title: Ellen Maccarmick Johns
item.description:
Ellen was born in 1859 to Edmund Allen Johns and Clara Louisa Braginton.

See Ellen’s MyHeritage entry for more hints, and BMD birth records.

She was living with her mother as of the 1881 census, and married George Stawell that year.

In the 1891 census, she is living in Plymouth with her husband, a cook and a servant. For the 1901 census she is still living with her husband, and two different servants, but now in Great Torrington, Devon. For 1911, she is still in Great Torrington with her husband, and two new servants.

item.title: Richard Braginton Johns
item.description:
Richard was born on 18 October 1862 (also FamilySearch record to Edmund Allen Johns and Clara Louisa Braginton).

See the Richard Braginton Johns Ancestry.com page for more suggestions.

He married Mary Sherwin in 1889. Mary probably died in 1898.

In 1902 he married Georgiana Lucy Deacon. Also see this FamilySearch page for Georgiana (needs login).

His household in Plymouth in the 1911 census is his wife, two children (see below) and a cook, two servants, a governess, a chauffeur and a stable boy.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a history website for the family of John Brett and Margaret Joy Whitehead.

item.title: Alice Jane Braginton
item.description:
Thanks to Bill Cooke for his sources on Braginton family history, see links on that page for details.

Alice Jane was born on 22 December 1845 (BMD record), and baptized on 13 February 1846, in St Giles on the Wood, Devon (source).

Martin Brett has an oak chest he inherited from Alice:

The chest has the following note inside:

Alice Jane married Samuel Henry Farwell Roe in 1890.

item.title: Braginton - Vicary
item.description:
See this page on Braginton family history, and this page on Vicary family history.

George Braginton, the oldest son of Richard Braginton, was baptised on 28 Feb 1808 in Ottery St Mary, Devon. On 13 Jan 1835, at St Giles in the Wood, he married Margaret Grace Vicary, the widow of William Cotton.

Also Alice Braginton’s Genenet entry and links therein.

George Braginton was baptised on 28 Feb 1808, and died on 9 January 1886 (GRO Index Mar 1886 Plympton 5b 201).

item.title: Braginton family history
item.description:
See this page on Braginton family history:

George Braginton, the oldest son of Richard Braginton, was baptised on 28 Feb 1808 in Ottery St Mary, Devon. On 13 Jan 1835, at St Giles in the Wood, he married Margaret Grace Vicary, the widow of William Cotton. Margaret Grace Vicary, the daughter of Thomas Cornish Vicary and Margaret Fry, was baptised at Great Torrington, Devon on 6 Dec 1807. Her marriage to William Cotton produced two children. Charles Newell Cotton was born in Barnstaple on 24 Mar 1830 while his sister, Fanny Eleanor William Cotton was born after the death of her father in Barnstaple on 26 Oct 1832.

item.title: Brett - Howcroft
item.description:
There is a Mary Ann Brett at this MyHeritage.com page that appears to match John Brett’s partner and Michael’s mother.

FeeBMD has no record of a marriage between “John Brett” and someone with surname “Howcroft” between 1840 and 1902. Christiana Payne’s biography notes that “as far as anyone has been able to ascertain, John Brett and Mary Ann Howcroft […] were never actually married.”

The record for John Brett’s household in the 1881 census records these household members at No 6 Keswick Road, London:

item.title: Brett - Lee
item.description:
Data for the family of Michael Brett and Nellie Mary Lee.

They married in early 1902 - see BMD record.

Michael’s census record for 1911 shows him to be living in Hangerlea, Stansted Road, Bishop’s Stortford, with this household:

Name Age
Michael Brett 39
Nellie Mary Brett 29
Joan Brett 8
John Brett 6
Peter Brett 1
Tirzah Faulder 25
Caroline Alice Hudgell 24
Annie Amelia Smith 27

Martin Brett described Nellie (“Granny Brett”) as “wonderfully accommodating”.

item.title: Brett - Pilbean
item.description:
These are notes for the family of Charles Curtis Brett and Ann Pilbean.

See Charles Curtis Brett’s wikitree entry. This says that he married Ann “Pilbin” on 12 June 1823. The Dictionary of National Biography has this as “Pilbean”, and Ann’s birth year as 1808/9 - see page on John Brett (painter).

Charles Curtis Brett’s household in the 1851 census:

Name Age Relation Profession
Charles C Brett 67 Head Vetinary surgeon ?army
Ann Brett 42 Wife
Rosa Brett 21 Daughter
John Brett 19 Son ? landscape ?
Theodore Brett 17 Son Scholar
Arthur Brett 15 Son Scholar at home
Edwin Brett 10 Son Scholar at home
Elizabeth Walker 47 Servant ?house?

See CCB 1851 census original image

item.title: Brett - Whitehead
item.description:
Note for the family of John Brett (b 1905) and (Margaret) Joy Whitehead.

They married on 5 May 1928. See also BMD record.

John and Joy had three children:

  • Sue Oliver (Malta, 24 May 1929 — 21 March 2021).
  • Jenifer Brooke-Smith (Portsmouth, September 1931 - 9 September 2023).
  • Martin Brett (Woolwich 6 January 1939).

See BMD records.

item.title: Burke's Peerage on Whitehead family
item.description:
See this Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage, 1949 for a full summary of the Whitehead family tree to 1949.

Quoting from that extract:

  1. Gilbert Hinds, b. 26 May, 1866 ; to. 10 April, 1901, •Helena Emmeline, (New Raven, Eltham, Kent), only dau. of late Henry A. Langford, of Plymouth, and d. 18 Dec. 1908, leaving issue,
    • Margaret Joy, m. 5 May, 1928, Lt.-Cmdr. John Brett, D.S.C., R.N., elder son of Michael Brett, of Bishop’s Stortford, and has issue. He was k. in action in H.M.S. Gloucester, off Crete, 22 May, 1941.

1959 edition adds only that Helena Emmeline died in 1949, and address for Margaret Joy of “Heath Cottage, Puttenham, Guildford, Surrey”.

item.title: Charles Curtis Brett
item.description:
See Charles Curtis Brett’s wikitree entry.

  • Grandfather: Curtis Brett (b ~1720), printer. CB wikitree entry. CB will. Biography as printer in Jamaica. His children were Charles Richard Brett (born and died 1761) and Curtis Brett (b 1765)
  • Father: Curtis Brett (b 1765). CB Jr wikitree entry.

Charles Curtis married Ann Pilbean in 1823.

… Charles Curtis Brett, had a background in both the army and the navy. He served as a midshipman on HMS Egmont, a 74-gun warship, between 1816 and 1823. In 1833, he joined the Twelfth Lancers, an army regiment, as a veterinary surgeon, and he continued to work in the army until his retirement in 1860.

item.title: Clara Louisa Braginton
item.description:
Clara Louisa’s parents were George Braginton and Margaret Grace Vicary.

Also see this page on Braginton family history.

From that page: Clara Louisa’s father was a shipowner, and probably named one of his ships “Clara Louisa” after his daughter.

Clara was born on 7 May 1837, and baptized in St Giles in the Wood church, Devon on 20 July 1937. Many thanks to Bill Cooke for this information, and the scan below of Clara’s baptismal register:

item.title: Gilbert Hinds Whitehead
item.description:
Gilbert Hinds was born on 26 May 1866, the fifth child of James Whitehead and Mercy Matilda Hinds.

He married Helena Emmeline Langford in 1901.

In 1890, he became a Liveryman of the Worshipful Company of Fruiterers and a Freeman of the City of London — see his profile in the archives of the Worshipful Company of Fruiterers. His application to be a Freeman has his signature:

The book Armorial families by Arthur Charles Fox-Davies (7th Edition, Hurst & Blackett Ltd, Londdon, 1929) (p 2079) has:

item.title: Helena Emmeline Langford
item.description:
Martin Brett tells me that “Granny Whitehead” preferred “Emmeline”.

Her birth certificate gives her date of birth as 10 May 1872. She was born at home, at 5 Hill Park Crescent, in Plymouth.

Emmeline’s parents were Henry Albert Langford and Clara Louisa Braginton.

See also Whitehead family grave and Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage.

In the 1881 census, Helena Emmilina Langford was at 5 North Hills Terrace, in the following household:

Name Age Relation Marriage Profession
Clara Louisa Langford 42 Head Widow Lady
Ellen Macornick Johns 22 Daughter Single Lady
Richard Braginton Johns 18 Son Single Solicitor’s articled clerk
Helena Emmilina Langford 8 Daughter Single Scholar
George Stawell Tuckey 27 Visitor Single Solicitor
Fanny Gent 47 Servant Single Cook Domestic
Elizabeth Dunn 16 Servant Single Housemaid

See the HEL 1881 census original image

item.title: Henry Albert Langford
item.description:
Henry Albert was probably born in Liskeard in late 1837 (BMD record).

He married Clara Louisa Johns (née Braginton) in 1866.

His daughter’s birth certificate gives his profession as “general merchant” in 1872. His probate and death certificate (see below) gives his profession as “accountant”.

There is a grave for “Henry A Langford” in St Mary’s Church, Callington, Cornwall, with inscription:

Henry A Langford who departed this life June 24th 1879, aged 41 years. “His end was peace”.

item.title: John Brett (b 1831)
item.description:
See John Brett’s wikipedia entry

The Dictionary of National Biography (1912) on John Brett (the painter). “BRETT, JOHN (1831–1902), landscape painter, born at Bletchingley, Surrey, on 8 Dec. 1831, was eldest son of Captain Charles Curtis Brett of the 12th lancers by his wife Ann Philbrick. […] He died in his house at Putney on 8 Jan. 1902. He married in 1870, and had four sons and three daughters who survived him. A portrait in oils by himself, painted about 1865, belongs to his son, Mr. Michael Brett.”

item.title: John Brett (b 1905)
item.description:
John died in World War 2, when his ship HMS Gloucester sank, on May 22nd 1941.

He was born on 27 March 1905 (see Peerage.com article).

He married Margaret Joy Whitehead on 5 May 1928.

John’s parents were Michael Brett and Nellie Mary Lee. Michael was the eldest son of John Brett, the painter.

He was commissioned into the Royal Navy on 15 September 1918, and gained these ranks:

  • Midshipman: 15 January 1923
  • Sub-Lieutenant: 15 November 1925
  • Lieutenant: 15 November 1927
  • Lieutenant-Commander: 15 November 1935.

Source for this last information is given in Peerage.com article as a unithistories.com page, but I can’t find John Brett at that link, now or via https://archive.org.

item.title: John Brett: Pre-Raphaelite Landcape Painter
item.description:
A biography of John Brett:

John Brett

Pre-Raphaelite Landscape Painter

Christiana Payne

September 21, 2010, Yale University Press

304 pages, 9.5 x 11

ISBN: 9780300165753

See the Yale University Press page.

item.title: Johns - Braginton
item.description:
Family page for Edmund Allen Johns and Clara Louisa Braginton.

They married in 1857. See their marriage record transcription, and the BMD record.

From the page above, and the census records below, and that listed in Helena Emmeline Langford’s page, Clara Louisa and Edmund Allen had at least three children:

  • Ellen Maccarmick Johns (1859 — 1938).
  • Richard Braginton Johns (1862 — 1952).
  • Edmund Allen Johns (1865 - 1929).

Bill Cooke (see below) tells me that Edmund Allen Johns (the father) was baptized on 21 Sep 1830 in Gerrans, Cornwall, England. He died in Veryan, near Truro on 2 November 1864, age 34. See BMD death record), and this grave inscription:

item.title: Langford - Braginton
item.description:
Henry Albert Langford married Clara Louisa Johns (née Braginton) in 1866, in Plymouth (BMD record).

The couple probably had two children:

  • Albert Leonard (1868-1879) (see below).
  • Helena Emmeline (1872-1949).

Albert Leonard Langford

Apart from Helena Emmeline, there was only one other Langford born in Plymouth between 1864 and 1890 - Albert Leonard Langford, in 1868 (BMD record).

Albert Leonard Langford died at age 11, in 1879, soon after his father, after “accidentally falling over the side of a quarry”.

item.title: Margaret Joy Whitehead
item.description:
Margaret Joy went by “Joy”.

Joy was born on 12 June 1905 (see BMD records for birth and death).

Her parents were Gilbert Hinds Whitehead and Helena Emmeline Whitehead.

She married John Brett in 1928, and had three children.

John died in 1941. Joy married Robert Clement Giles in 1965 (see Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage). Robert Clement Giles was a staff officer in intelligence in Hong Kong when it fell to the Japanese in 1941, and was a prisoner of war until 1945.

item.title: Michael Brett
item.description:
From Christiana Payne’s biography of John brett p 109, Michael born on July 1871.

See Michael’s Wikisource data. This suggests his BMD birth record.

From the 1893 book Oxford Men 1880-1892, by Joseph Foster:

Brett, Michael, born at Roehampton, Surrey, 23 July, 1871 ; IS, John, A.R.A. New Coll., matric. 10 Oct. . 90, aged 19, from Winchester

The Wikisource page has the following:

The Standard (London, England), Wednesday, November 18, 1896; pg. 4; Issue 22585. (363 words) — CALLS TO THE BAR. states of New College, Oxford

item.title: MyHeritage entry for Mary Ann Howcroft
item.description:
There is a Mary Ann Brett at this MyHeritage.com page that appears to match John Brett’s partner and Michael’s mother.

Mary Ann Brett, Brett (born Howcroft) was born on month day 1843, at birth place, to William HOWCROFT and Mary Anne HOWCROFT (born HALL).

William was born in 1791, in Yorkshire, England.

Mary was born on April 21 1815, in Worthing, Sussex, England.

Mary was baptized on month day 1844, at baptism place.

item.title: Roe - Braginton
item.description:
The family of Samuel Henry Farwell Roe and Alice Jane Braginton.

They married in 1890 (BMD record).

It seems they had no children. Alice Jane was 44 when they married.

item.title: Samuel Henry Farwell Roe
item.description:
See Farwell Roe Genenet page.

Samuel Henry Farwell Roe was born in 1856 (BMD record). He was the son of the Reverend Henry Farwell Roe, Rector of Lesnewth, Cornwall, and Isabella Messenger (source).

Roe married Alice Jane Braginton in 1890.

Farwell was vicar at Zennor, Cornwall from 1888 to 1900. From this blog on an historical diary about Saint Senara’s church at Zennor:

However, by the late 19th Century the Church had become neglected and when the Reverend Samuel Henry Farwell Roe became Vicar in 1888 he realised it was in need of restoration.

item.title: Vicary family history
item.description:
William Cooke sent much of the information on this page, including the transcription of the Vicary family bible. Thank you to him, for his great generosity in sharing his research, and his care in doing it.

Quoting the transcript:

1835 - Jan 13th. The above named Margaret Grace Relict of the above named William Cotton was married in the Church of St. Giles in the Wood - Devon - to George Braginton Son of Richard Branginton & Anne his wife

item.title: Whitehead - Langford
item.description:
About the family of Gilbert Hinds Whitehead and Helena Emmeline Langford.

See Whitehead extract from Burke’s peerage for full summary of Whitehead family tree to 1949. From that source, the couple:

  • Married on 10 April 1901 (source above).
  • had one child, Margaret Joy, in 1905 (BMD record).

See transcription of full marriage record, and BMD record.

Gilbert Hinds Whitehead died in 1908.

item.title: Whitehead family grave
item.description:
This site about a gravesite for the Whitehead family has the following information:

Gilbert Hinds Whitehead

Third son of Sir James Whitehead. Bart.

Born 26th May 1866, died 18th December 1908

Helena Emmeline, wife of the above

Born 10 May 1872, died 18 Oct 1949

item.title: William Cooke and the Braginton / Vicary families
item.description:
William (Bill) Cooke kindly sent a great deal of carefully sourced information the Braginton and Vicary families. He has a particular interest in the history of some Devon parishes, in particular, the parishes of St Giles in the Wood, High Bickington, Atherington, Tawstock and Yarnscombe.

Bill sent the wonderful transcription of the Vicary family bible, a detailed summary of Braginton family history, and Clara Louisa Braginton’s baptismal record.

He also very generously allowed me (Matthew Brett) to share this information on the website.

Reverend Samuel Henry Farwell Roe

Births Sep 1856 (>99%) Roe Samuel Henry Farwell Camelford 5c 10

Deaths Mar 1943 (>99%) ROE Samuel H F 86 Barnstaple 5b 567

A grave from Marlborough Road Cemetery, Ilfracombe, Devon:

https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124810872/farwell-roe

““” Sacred to the memory of Revd Farwell Roe died 19th March 1943

Also of Jane Roe, his wife, died 23rd February 1948.” ““”

Deaths Mar 1948 (>99%) Roe Jane 69 Barnstaple 7a 293

item.title: Talking to Martin Brett
item.description:
Conversation between Matthew and Martin Brett, 10 May 2020

Helena Emmeline preferred “Emmeline”.

Emmeline lived with “Aunt Alice” and an unfriendly vicar in Zennor, in Cornwall. She (Granny Whitehead) would do an impression of the thick accent of the postman.

A distant relative, surname Johns, gave a significant amount of money to Emmeline in his will, enough to buy a car.

Another conversation maybe in June

Joan, John and Peter Brett were the three children of Michael Brett and Nellie Mary Lee.
